name: European & International Booksellers Federation
membership: EIBF is part of Creativity Works!, a leading coalition of organisations, federations and associations representing Europe’s cultural and creative sectors. (http://www.creativityworks.eu)
goal:
EIBF represents Booksellers Associations in the EU, the EEA and out of Europe. Through its Member Associations, EIBF represents more than 25.000 individual booksellers.
In this capacity, EIBF is the legitimate voice of European and International booksellers.
The objectives of EIBF are to represent booksellers' interests in particular vis-à-vis the European institutions.
By gathering booksellers associations from across Europe, EIBF also fosters exchanges of best practices between its members and acts as a forum for discussion and cooperation between national booksellers associations.
interests: Business and Industry, Competition, Consumers, Culture, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Single market, Taxation, Trade
euInitiatives:
• Fair competition and level playing field for all retailers
• Favourable taxation of books in all formats to promote reading
• Interoperability of e-book formats
• Fair lending schemes by libraries for the benefit of the book chain and readers
• Cross-border sales of e-books
• Copyright as the backbone of the book industry
